title: Makis Katsavakis
text:
Makis Katsavakis (; born 26 December 1953) is a Greek professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and former player.
Career.
Born in Peponia, <a href="Serres">Serres</a>, Katsavakis began playing football as a defender for local <a href="Alpha%20Ethniki">Alpha Ethniki</a> side <a href="Panserraikos%20F.C.">Panserraikos F.C.</a>. He joined Alpha Ethniki rivals <a href="Olympiacos%20F.C.">Olympiacos F.C.</a> in 1977. He finished his career with <a href="Korinthos%20F.C.">Korinthos F.C.</a> in 1982.
After he retired from playing, Katsavakis became a football coach. He was appointed manager by <a href="Edessaikos%20F.C.">Edessaikos F.C.</a> in 1992. He managed several Greek clubs over the following years, including <a href="Veria%20F.C.">Veria F.C.</a>, <a href="PAS%20Giannina%20F.C.">PAS Giannina F.C.</a>, <a href="Panionios%20F.C.">Panionios F.C.</a>, <a href="Paniliakos%20F.C.">Paniliakos F.C.</a>, <a href="Olympiakos%20Volos%20F.C.">Olympiakos Volos F.C.</a>, <a href="Panserraikos%20F.C.">Panserraikos F.C.</a>, <a href="Aris%20Thessaloniki%20F.C.">Aris Thessaloniki F.C.</a>, <a href="Levadiakos%20F.C.">Levadiakos F.C.</a>, <a href="Apollon%20Kalamarias%20F.C.">Apollon Kalamarias F.C.</a>, <a href="Iraklis%20Thessaloniki%20F.C.">Iraklis Thessaloniki F.C.</a> and <a href="Doxa%20Drama%20F.C.">Doxa Drama</a>. He also managed Cypriot side <a href="AEK%20Larnaca">AEK Larnaca</a>.
